org.tmotte.pdfrpt.report.item

Class PText

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tmotte.pdfrpt.report.ReportItem
      • org.tmotte.pdfrpt.report.item.AbstractText
        • org.tmotte.pdfrpt.report.item.PText

  • public class PText
extends AbstractText
    Allows for rendering of simple text data. For multi-line text, use PTextLines.

    Notes:

    • By default, text is left-aligned (left-justified).
    • Increasing the height of PText (via setHeight() or addHeight()) only affects the amount of space below the text rendered. The text is always rendered from the top/left corner. Use FontInfo to obtain more specific spacing and font sizing.
    • Setting the width of a PText has no effect on character spacing; extra space appears to the the left and/or right of the text depending on alignment.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.tmotte.pdfrpt.report.item.AbstractText

        REPLACE_CURR_PAGE, REPLACE_PAGE_COUNT

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PText(float width, FontInfo fontInfo, java.lang.String text)
      Works the same as PText(fontInfo, width, text).
      PText(FontInfo fontInfo, float width, java.lang.String text)
      Constructs a PText using the specified font, width and text; also sets the height as determined by fontInfo.getTextLineHeight().
      PText(FontInfo fontInfo, java.lang.String text)
      Constructs a PText with width & height equal to the width and height of text as determined by fontInfo.getWidth(text) and fontInfo.getTextLineHeight().
      PText(SimplePDF pdf, float width, java.lang.String text)
      A shortcut to PText(pdf.getFontInfo(), width, text).
      PText(SimplePDF pdf, java.lang.String text)
      A shortcut to PText(pdf.getFontInfo(), text)

    • Constructor Detail

      • PText

        public PText(FontInfo fontInfo,
             float width,
             java.lang.String text)
        Constructs a PText using the specified font, width and text; also sets the height as determined by fontInfo.getTextLineHeight().
        Parameters:
        fontInfo - Font information for rendering the text.
        width - The desired width of the PText element. Extra space will appear to the left and/or right of this PText depending on left/right/center alignment settings.
        text - The text to display.

      • PText

        public PText(FontInfo fontInfo,
             java.lang.String text)
        Constructs a PText with width & height equal to the width and height of text as determined by fontInfo.getWidth(text) and fontInfo.getTextLineHeight().
        Parameters:
        fontInfo - Contains font information for rendering the text.
        text - The text to display.

    • Method Detail

      • rightAlign

        public PText rightAlign()
        Causes text to be right-aligned when printed. This only has an effect when the width of this PText is set to a value greater than the width of its rendered text.
        See Also:
        PText(FontInfo, float, String), ReportItem.setWidth(float)

      • center

        public PText center()
        Causes text to be horizontally centered when printed. This only has an effect when the width of this PText is set to a value greater than the width of its rendered text.
        See Also:
        PText(FontInfo, float, String), ReportItem.setWidth(float)

      • setPageCount

        public PText setPageCount(PageCount pc)
        Overrides AbstractText.setPageCount() for method-chaining convenience.
        Overrides:
        setPageCount in class AbstractText
        See Also:
        AbstractText.setPageCount(PageCount)

      • print

        public void print(SimplePDF pdf)
        Prints this PText instance. Center/right-alignment is handled here. Also, if a PageCount instance has been assigned, values for PText.REPLACE_CURR_PAGE and PText.REPLACE_PAGE_COUNT will be obtained and inserted into the text drawn.
        Specified by:
        print in class ReportItem
        See Also:
        setPageCount(PageCount)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Prints the text contents of this instance, for debugging purposes.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
